derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from obsolete French invasif, -ive or medieval Latin invasivus, from Latin invadere (see invade)

entry.def: You use invasive to describe something undesirable which spreads very quickly and which is very difficult to stop from spreading.

example.ex: They found invasive cancer during a routine examination.
example.tran: 他们在常规体检中发现了扩散性的癌变。

entry.def: An invasive medical procedure involves operating on a patient or examining the inside of their body.

example.ex: Many people find the idea of any kind of invasive surgery unbearable.
example.tran: 很多人认为任何开刀手术都不堪忍受。

means.word_mean: 1. relating to a technique in which the body is entered by puncture or incision
2. marked by a tendency to spread especially into healthy tissue;
4. gradually intrusive without right or permission;

sentences.sentence: "we moved back from the encroaching tide"
